last_episode_to_air.name: Calculating
last_episode_to_air.overview: Harvest time arrives and is tenser than ever, as Jeremy and Kaleb find out how profitable both Jeremy's new projects and Kaleb's arable farming have been this year.

name: Clarkson's Farm
overview: Follow Jeremy Clarkson as he embarks on his latest adventure, farming. The man who on several occasions claims to be allergic to manual labour takes on the most manually labour intensive job there is. What could possibly go wrong?

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: Another year in the life of Diddly Squat Farm, run by Jeremy Clarkson, Britain's best-known but least-qualified amateur farmer. In an effort to increase his annual profit (£144 last year) he's diversifying, in the shape of cows, more chickens and his own restaurant.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: After the triumphant finale of Season 2, we return to Diddly Squat to find everything in turmoil. The council has shut the restaurant and the weather is ruining the crops. Desperate for new income streams Jeremy enters a world of pig breeding, goat attacks and mushroom mountains. Meanwhile Kaleb, promoted to farm manager, deals with an unwelcome rival. The funniest, most heartbreaking season yet.

episodes.name: Tractoring
episodes.overview: Jeremy Clarkson embarks on his path towards muddy misery and potential ruin by running his own farm

episodes.name: Sheeping
episodes.overview: Jeremy decides to get a flock of sheep, not realising the added complications these high-maintenance animals will bring.

episodes.name: Shopping
episodes.overview: Jeremy Clarkson decides to open a farm shop to sell his own produce. This sounds like it should be easy. It isn't.

episodes.name: Wilding
episodes.overview: Jeremy Clarkson decides to become a naturalist.

episodes.name: Pan (dem) icking
episodes.overview: As Covid-19 puts Britain on lockdown, Jeremy suddenly finds that his biggest worries aren't all related to the upcoming lambing season.

episodes.name: Melting
episodes.overview: Jeremy discovers why British farmers are always complaining about the weather. It's mostly because it never does what they want it to do.

episodes.name: Fluffing
episodes.overview: As the drought drags on and the harvest time gets closer, Jeremy and his motley crew have a fearsome list of jobs to complete.

episodes.name: Harvesting
episodes.overview: After months of hard work Clarkson's farm arrives at a make or break moment; harvest time.

episodes.name: Surviving
episodes.overview: Jeremy Clarkson sets out to diversify, as a way of increasing his annual profit (£144 last year).

episodes.name: Cowering
episodes.overview: Jeremy's new herd of cows settle in, but soon reject the fence that keeps them in.

episodes.name: Schmoozing
episodes.overview: Faced with Council powers that be, Jeremy uses two of his greatest skills: diplomacy and respect for red tape.

episodes.name: Badgering
episodes.overview: Jeremy Clarkson comes face to face with his nemesis: the badger.

episodes.name: Council-ing
episodes.overview: The day of the Council's decision on Jeremy's restaurant arrives.

guest_stars.character: Self - Uplands Area Planning Committee chairman
guest_stars.name: Jeff Haine

episodes.name: Counselling
episodes.overview: The fall-out from the Council's decision continues to fall out.

episodes.name: Scheming
episodes.overview: Jeremy's restaurant idea is re-born, and there's not a moment to waste.

episodes.name: Climaxing
episodes.overview: Secret preparations accelerate for the opening of Jeremy's restaurant.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: Another year in the life of Diddly Squat Farm, run by Jeremy Clarkson, Britain's best-known but least-qualified amateur farmer. In an effort to increase his annual profit (£144 last year) he's diversifying, in the shape of cows, more chickens and his own restaurant.

episodes.name: Unfarming
episodes.overview: We return to Diddly Squat to find the farm in turmoil. The Council has shut down the restaurant, the weather is making planting crops impossible and costs are on the up. Jeremy needs to formulate a new plan to get his farm through the year.

episodes.name: Porking
episodes.overview: Jeremy sets to work getting the farm ready for its newest residents, some Sand and Black pigs. Meanwhile Kaleb is annoyed when he spots someone else drilling in his fields.

episodes.name: Jobbing
episodes.overview: It's Christmas time on the farm and Kaleb gives Jeremy a festive surprise. However their relationship becomes strained as they bicker while getting on with the farms winter jobs.

episodes.name: Harrowing
episodes.overview: Jeremy treats Kaleb to something he hopes will help with his farming, and Lisa and Jeremy discover just how tough being pig farmers can be.

episodes.name: Healing
episodes.overview: Spring has sprung and rejuvinated Jeremy's farming the unfarmed idea, as he takes on multiple new projects to try and turn a profit from his unused land.. And there are some one week old arrivals to the farm to lift everyone's spirits.

episodes.name: Mushrooming
episodes.overview: Jeremy's mushroom empire begins to appear all consuming as he struggles to keep on top of his newest venture and Kaleb and Charlie are off to London for a very important meeting.

episodes.name: Parking
episodes.overview: Team Diddly assemble for a much needed building project and Jeremy brings in the Chairman of the British Deer Society to help with the deer management issues on the farm.

episodes.name: Calculating
episodes.overview: Harvest time arrives and is tenser than ever, as Jeremy and Kaleb find out how profitable both Jeremy's new projects and Kaleb's arable farming have been this year.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview: After the triumphant finale of Season 2, we return to Diddly Squat to find everything in turmoil. The council has shut the restaurant and the weather is ruining the crops. Desperate for new income streams Jeremy enters a world of pig breeding, goat attacks and mushroom mountains. Meanwhile Kaleb, promoted to farm manager, deals with an unwelcome rival. The funniest, most heartbreaking season yet.
